description: System-generated unique identifier for this level‑9 organizational grouping or cost center.
Date and time the record was last updated, stored in a compact yyyymmddhhmmssmmm format.
Indicates whether the organizational unit is inactive/retired and excluded from active assignments and counts.
Official name of the level‑9 organizational unit or program that owns or uses fleet assets.
Business code for the level‑9 unit (department/program identifier) used on assets, work orders, and reports.
Free‑text notes about the unit; may include accounting or cost center references; confirm with SME.
Number of vehicles currently in service and roadworthy under this unit.
Count of vehicles in nonstandard statuses (e.g., shop, reserve, pending); likely aggregated; confirm with SME.
Count of vehicles designated as surplus or disposal associated with this unit.
General ledger or cost center code tied to this unit for accounting and chargeback.
Reference/lookup identifier describing how glcode is resolved (e.g., related table/key); confirm with SME.
Likely employee headcount associated with this unit; used for allocation or reporting; confirm with SME.
Reference/lookup metadata indicating the relation used to resolve the employee field; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the parent level‑2 organization to which this unit reports (foreign key).
Reference/lookup metadata naming the parent hierarchy relation used by hierlvl2.
Identifier for this unit in a prior/legacy system to support cross‑system mapping.
Name of the table or entity in the legacy system where the legacy key originated.
Contact email address for the unit or its primary contact.
Website or intranet URL associated with the unit.
Postal or ZIP code for the unit’s mailing/location address.
Fax number for contacting the unit.
Primary telephone number for the unit.
City for the unit’s address.
Secondary address line, such as suite, building, or floor.
Street address for the unit’s location or mailing.
State or province code/ID for the address; may be a lookup key; confirm with SME.
Reference/lookup metadata naming the state enumeration used by the state field.
